meanings.definition: Taking advantage of others' generosity without giving anything in return.
meanings.sent1: Freeloading is when someone takes things without giving back.
meanings.sent2: She was caught freeloading at the party, eating all the snacks without contributing.
meanings.sent3: The freeloading squirrel kept stealing nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His freeloading behavior drained the goodwill of his friends.
meanings.sent5: The concept of freeloading is frowned upon in our community.

meanings.definition: The act of receiving goods or services without paying for them.
meanings.sent1: Freeloading can lead to strained relationships when done excessively.
meanings.sent2: He was accused of freeloading by constantly borrowing money and never returning it.
meanings.sent3: The freeloading cat always sneaks into the neighbor's house to steal food.
meanings.sent4: Her freeloading ways eventually caught up with her when she was cut off from all help.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of freeloading can be severe in a close-knit community.

meanings.definition: Someone who habitually relies on others for support or resources.
meanings.sent1: The freeloading friend always conveniently forgets their wallet when going out.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been a freeloading roommate when she never paid her share of the rent.
meanings.sent3: The freeloading seagull scavenged for food scraps left by beachgoers.
meanings.sent4: Being a freeloading dependent can strain even the strongest relationships.
meanings.sent5: The freeloading behavior of the employee led to resentment among coworkers.
